featured.text: The earliest record of people wearing the flip-flop comes from Egypt, but many ancient cultures had their own variants of the footwear.
In the 1950s, flip-flops became popular in the United States as soldiers returning from occupied Japan brought zōris home.
Modern flip-flops derive from Japanese zōris, which were often worn with socks dividing the big toe from the rest, and were typically made of rice straw.

other.text: Rubber thus replaced rice straw as the major material for the flip-flop.
Which of the following is true about the modern development of the flip-flop? (A) Modern flip-flops originated from Indian toe knob sandals.
Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a concern of wearing the flip-flop?
Despite their popularity, flip-flops provoke some questions.
Why is the footwear discussed in the passage called “flip-flop”?
The sandals American soldiers brought home from Japan later became modern flip-flops.

definition.zh_def: 失敗，特別是在娛樂或商業中未能成功的情況。
definition.en_def: A failure, especially in the context of entertainment or business where something does not succeed.
definition.example: The movie was a total flop at the box office.
